physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Subject A-IV-21 (2-yr-old boy) presented with failure to thrive; Subject A-III-18 (34-yr-old father) reported life-long symptoms of polydipsia and polyuria, with nocturia.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Subject A-IV-21 demonstrated decelerated weight gain from 9 months of age and retarded length from 1.5 years, which recovered upon treatment with 1-desamino-8-D-arginine vasopressin (DDAVP). Subject B-IV-9 had growth retardation from age 3 and improved with DDAVP treatment resulting in better appetite and weight gain.

physical_examinations.vital_signs: Plasma osmolality rose to 315 mosmol/kg; urinary osmolality was 400 mosmol/kg; plasma VP concentration was 1.3 pg/mL.
physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Water deprivation test confirmed neurohypophysial diabetes insipidus in Subject A-IV-21.
